thread.title: David Moyes begins search for left-back with Patrick van Aanholt set to quit Sunderland for Crystal Palace
thread.title_full: David Moyes begins search for left-back with Patrick van Aanholt set to quit Sunderland for Crystal Palace

author: dwright
title: David Moyes begins search for left-back with Patrick van Aanholt set to quit Sunderland for Crystal Palace
text:
moyes left looking David Moyes begins search for left-back with Patrick van Aanholt set to quit Sunderland for Crystal Palace 
Black Cats boss on the hunt-for defender to replace Dutchman he fears will move to Selhurst Park Exclusive Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window) Comments DAVID MOYES is stepping up his search for a left-back – as Patrick van Aanholt closes in on Crystal Palace. 
Palace boss Sam Allardyce has been attempting to land Van Aanholt for a month and stepped up his interest after missing out on Carl Jenkinson last week. PA:Press Association Wire 3 Patrick van Aanholt is expected to leave Sunderland for Crystal Palace this week 
Black Cats boss Moyes has now been forced to dip actively in the market for a replacement for Van Aanholt with it growing increasingly likely he will be on the move. 
Keep up to date with ALL the Sunderland news , gossip, transfers and goals on our club page plus fixtures, results and live match commentary 
Palace could bid as much as £12million to force a deal through, and the ex-Chelsea defender could make the switch as early as this week. Getty Images David Moyes has begun the search for a new left-back at Sunderland West Brom 2-0 Sunderland : Fletcher and Brunt condemn Black Cats to loss 
Moyes has been told he can use £10m from the sale of the Dutch full-back to strengthen his Sunderland squad and add quality to his first team. 
Big Sam wants to be reunited with Van Aanholt after working with him at Sunderland. 
He has been targeted by Allardyce to as his priority is to find a left-back as Pape Souare is crocked. 
The 26-year-old was also on the hit-list of Swansea boss Paul Clement, who knew him from their time together at Chelsea, but they moved for Martin Olsson in a £5m deal. PA:Press Association 3 Patrick van Aanholt may have played hislast game for Sunderland in the defeat at West Brom 
Sunderland boss Moyes was interested in Robbie Brady but the Norwich wide-man has rejected a move to the Stadium Of Light. 
The Republic of Ireland international will chose between Bournemouth and Burnley in a £13m deal instead.
